author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the loom of the eurozone, there lies a tale doth told,
Of bond issuance's meek retreat, aggregates to behold.
Just eight and half a billion yon, at Commerzbank they speak,
The lowest weekly volume rings, culmination's peak.

Mixed echoes rise from the metals' bed, a struggle dire and bleak,
The base runs low, the gold runs high, while global growth stays weak.
In London mourn or London scoff, the story's far from done,
With dawn's light, comes the stifled song, and the battle just begun.

In lands afar, the dollar stands, in strength, in trial, in hope,
Awaiting the Jackson Hole decree, with rising bonds we cope.
In whispers spoke, in silence kept, the Powell speech's sway,
Could usher in a new dawn's song, or fade into the fray.

feedItems.title: Lowest Weekly Government Bond Supply Expected in Eurozone This Week
feedItems.description: Government bond issuance in the eurozone is expected to reach around €8.5 billion this week, marking the lowest weekly volume of the year, Commerzbank Research said.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed as Demand Continues to Struggle
feedItems.description: Base metals prices were mixed while gold edged higher in early London trading, with indexes continuing to be stifled by weak global growth.

feedItems.title: Dollar Should Stay Strong This Week as Traders Await Jackson Hole
feedItems.description: The dollar should hold onto its recent gains this week due to rising U.S. government-bond yields and anticipation of Powell’s speech at the Jackson Hole symposium, ING said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Dark as raven's wing, the tide of black gold doth flow,
Twixt the hands of speculators, in their dance of give and throw.
As tight as Odin's hand on Mjölnir, with supply scarce do we wrestle,
In the gloaming, they envision prospects shine, as Asgard's celestial castle.

With speed as swift as Fenrir's chase, the prices of homes doth downturn,
In the isles of mist and legend, a financial Fenrir takes his turn.
Summer's lull dost it outpace, its bite 1.9 fold to dread,
A chill as frigid as Niflheim's realm, in the hearts of homeowners is spread.

From the land where the Ganga's tears do flow, a rise in stocks is spied,
Artful as Freya, tech shares lead, on positive sentiment do they ride.
No fears of bank's tightening grip, no woe of borrowed gold,
For now, as Thor's mighty hammer, the Sensex stands, bold.

feedItems.title: Oil Rises As Speculators Bet on Higher Prices
feedItems.description: Oil prices rose, with speculators looking to position for higher prices in the near future, amid tight inventories globally.

feedItems.title: UK House Prices Fall at Fastest Rate Since 2018
feedItems.description: The average house price in the U.K. fell 1.9% in the month to August 12, outpacing the usual summer slowdown.

feedItems.title: India's Sensex Rises 0.2%, Led by Tech Stocks
feedItems.description: Indian shares were higher, led by tech stocks, as concerns recede for now about policy tightening by central banks and higher costs of borrowing.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Beneath Eastern stars, where warriors jest and spar,
The Gulf state finds a golden cup, yanked from Russia's cellar sore,
For war's bitter brew, to nations far, doth bring merchant's blessings more.

IKEA boasts its banner bright o'er San Francisco's broken street,
Where labor's flight and darkness blight doth offer store a seat,
Surely can their flat-pack might mend this shattered retreat?

Old Dominion, sturdy, strong, outbids another in the race,
A silver stream, so vast, so long, for Yellow's earthly space,
One man's ruin, another's song, thus turns Fortune's face.

feedItems.title: U.A.E. Cashes In on Russia's Economic Woes
feedItems.description: The Gulf state is capitalizing on the Ukraine war’s economic opportunities like few other countries.

feedItems.title: IKEA is set to open a store Wednesday in San Francisco's beleaguered downtown district, which has been hollowed out by an exodus of workers and has struggled with crime, drug abuse and homelessness.
feedItems.description: IKEA is set to open a store Wednesday in San Francisco’s beleaguered downtown district, which has been hollowed out by an exodus of workers and has struggled with crime, drug abuse and homelessness.

feedItems.title: Old Dominion Freight Line outbid a rival with a $1.5 billion offer for bankrupt trucker Yellow's sprawling North American real-estate holdings.
feedItems.description: Old Dominion Freight Line outbid a rival with a $1.5 billion offer for bankrupt trucker Yellow’s sprawling North American real-estate holdings.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Macau's glowing halls of chance,
Where Eastern luck takes merry dance.
Just like snails to garden's hue,
Returns the crowd, gambling anew. 

In globes of glass and twists of thread,
Where rabbit roams and has its bed,
Investors rush to claim their prize,
In money's song, their hopes arise.

Bluebirds chirp a humble song,
In e-commerce, bargains throng.
Alibaba, JD's might,
Bring bargain hunt in dawn's soft light.

feedItems.title: Chinese tourists are again flocking to Macau's casinos, propelling the city back above Las Vegas as the world's most lucrative gambling hub.
feedItems.description: Chinese tourists are again flocking to Macau’s casinos, propelling the city back above Las Vegas as the world’s most lucrative gambling hub.

feedItems.title: Investors are rushing to scoop up money-market funds and other cash-like instruments that are offering robust returns after a decade of ultralow rates.
feedItems.description: Investors are rushing to scoop up money-market funds and other cash-like instruments that are offering robust returns after a decade of ultralow rates.

feedItems.title: China's biggest e-commerce firms, Alibaba and JD.com, are moving toward selling more discounted goods as Chinese shoppers hunt for bargains amid economic uncertainty.
feedItems.description: China’s biggest e-commerce firms, Alibaba and JD.com, are moving toward selling more discounted goods as Chinese shoppers hunt for bargains amid economic uncertainty.
